qas.question: When did madolin awareness in the US become fluent?
When was the first madolin made in the US?
Who made the first US mandolin?
What type of madolin was Partee using ?
When didn't madolin awareness in the US become fluent?
When was the first mandolin destroyed in the US?
Who made the first UK mandolin?
What type of mandolin was Partee not using?

context: Mandolin awareness in the United States blossomed in the <a0_0><b5_0>1880s<b5_0/><a0_0/>, as the instrument became part of a fad that continued into the mid-1920s. According to Clarence L. Partee, the first mandolin made in the United States was made in <a1_0><b6_0>1883 or 1884<b6_0/><a1_0/> by <a2_0><b7_0>Joseph Bohm<a2_0/>ann<b7_0/>, who was an established maker of violins in <a3_0>Chicago<a3_0/>. Partee characterized the early instrument as being larger than the European instruments he was used to, with a "peculiar shape" and "crude construction," and said that the quality improved, until American instruments were "superior" to imported instruments. At the time, Partee was using an imported <a4_0><b8_0>French-made mandolin<b8_0/><a4_0/>.
